pr_title: HIVE-24120 Plugin for external DatabaseProduct in standalone HMS

timeline.message: account for EXTERNAL in SQL generator
Add overridable methods to class DatabaseProduct
Use new methods in DatabaseProduct consistently
add method to get database properties
update references to Derby and MySQL in hcatalog
Simplify instantiation logic and accoung for concurrency

replies.bodyText:
:-) ... It's so that we don't fall into the assertion you suggested right above (i.e. "Preconditions.checkState(this.dbType == getDbType(productName));").
There is a test in the Hive test suite that creates multiple instances of DatabaseProduct for different databases, which fails unless the instance is reset.
I had added the same assertion you suggested when I originally wrote the code, but then removed it when I got bitten by the test. I was on the fence of whether the assertion was useful or not, so I removed it. I now put it back, along with the calls to reset() in the test.

replies.bodyText: Sorry, may be should have been clearer. I meant adding the text "Use an external RDBMS which is not in the list of natively supported databases (e.g. Derby, Mysql, Oracle, Postgres, MSSQL), as defined by hive.metastore.db.type. If this configuration is true, the metastore.custom.database.product.classname must be set to a valid class name" as the fourth argument in the USE_CUSTOM_RDBMS. IIRC this description is used to generate the template for default hive-site.xml so that the description is present in the xml file itself.
